Diagnosis.
E. berndtiella
is characterized by the large, elongate juxta lobes that are longer than uncus lobes, different from any other species in the
E. dispunctella
complex. The phallus is bent, acute-tipped, and stout. The female is unknown.

Biology.
E. berndtiella
inhabits xerothermic limestone habitats. The immature stages are unknown.

Remarks .
E. berndtiella
is referred to as OTU 7 in Mutanen et al . ( 2015 ).
